titles: A merry dialogue betwixt a married man and his wife, concerning the affaires of this carefull life To an excellent tune.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?, attributed name.
publisher: Printed by the assignes of Thomas Symcocke,
notes: Verse - "I have for all good wives a song,".
Attribution to Parker and suggested place and date of publication from STC.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
